intro: Gaertnera stictophylla, commonly known as the white-veined mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of its host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves with prominent white veins, and its flowers are typically white or pale green. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are a source of food for birds and other animals. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments.
